author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: When he looks into the mirror, he might notice his hair needs a trim.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: So he'll probably ask for a pair of nail scissors.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: When he's finished giving himself a trim, he'll want a broom to sweep up.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll start sweeping.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He might get carried away and sweep every room in the house.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He may even end up washing the floors as well!

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: When he's done, he'll probably want to take a nap.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: You'll have to fix up a little box for him with a blanket and a pillow.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll crawl in, make himself comfortable and fluff the pillow a few times.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll probably ask you to read him a story.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: So you'll read to him from one of your books, and he'll ask to see the pictures.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: When he looks at the pictures, he'll get so excited he'll want to draw one of his own.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll ask for paper and crayons.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll draw a picture.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: When the picture is finished, he'll want to sign his name with a pen.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: Then he'll want to hang his picture on your refrigerator.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: Which means he'll need Scotch tape.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: He'll hang up his drawing and stand back to look at it.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: Looking at the refrigerator will remind him that he's thirsty.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: So. . .  he'll ask for a glass of milk.

title: IF YOU GIVE A MOUSE A COOKIE
author: LAURA JOFFE NUMEROFF
text: And chances are if he asks for a glass of milk, he's going to want a cookie to go with it.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Congratulations!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Today is your day.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You're off to Great Places!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You're off and away!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You have brains in your head.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You have feet in your shoes.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You can steer yourself any direction you choose.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You're on your own.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And you know what you know.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And YOU are the guy who'll decide where to go.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll look up and down streets.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look 'em over with care.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: About some you will say, I don't choose to go there.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With your head full of brains and your shoes full of feet, you're too smart to go down any not-so-good street.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And you may not find any you'll want to go down.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: In that case, of course, you'll head straight out of town.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It's opener there in the wide open air.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Out there things can happen and frequently do to people as brainy and footsy as you.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And when things start to happen, don't worry.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Don't stew.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Just go right along.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll start happening too.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: THE PLACES YOU'LL GO!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll be on your way up!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll be seeing great sights!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll join the high fliers who soar to high heights.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You won't lag behind, because you'll have the speed.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll pass the whole gang and you'll soon take the lead.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Wherever you fly, you'll be best of the best.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Wherever you go, you will top all the rest.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Except when you don't.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Because, sometimes, you won't.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm sorry to say so but, sadly, it's true that Bang-ups and Hang-ups can happen to you.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You can get all hung up in a prickle-ly perch.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And your gang will fly on.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll be left in a Lurch.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll come down from the Lurch with an unpleasant bump.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the chances are, then, that you'll be in Slump.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And when you're in a Slump, you're not in for much fun.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Un-slumping yourself is not easily done.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will come to a place where the streets are not marked.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Some windows are lighted.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Bur mostly they're darked.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: A place you could sprain both your elbow and chin!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Do you dare to stay out?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Do you dare to go in?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: How much can you lose?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: How much can you win?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And IF you go in, should you turn left or right. . .  or right-and-three-quarters?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Or, maybe, not quite?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Or go around back and sneak in from behind?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Simple it's not, I'm afraid you will find, for a mind-maker-upper to make up his mind.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You can get so confused that you'll start in to race down long wiggled roads at a break-necking pace and grind on for miles across weirdish wild space, headed, I fear, toward a most useless place.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The Waiting Place. . .  for people just waiting.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Waiting for a train to go or a bus to come, or a plane to go or the mail to come, or the rain to go or the phone to ring, or the snow to snow or waiting around for a yes or No or waiting for their hair to grow.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Everyone is just waiting.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Waiting for the fish to bite or waiting for wind to fly a kite or waiting around for Friday night or waiting, perhaps, for their Uncle Jake or a pot to boil, or a Better Break or a string of pearls, or a pair of pants or a wig with curls, or Another Chance.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Everyone is just waiting.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: NO!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That s not for you!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Somehow you'll escape all that waiting and staying.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll find the bright places where Boom Bands are playing.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With banner flip-flapping, once more you'll ride high!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Ready for anything under the sky.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Ready because you're that kind of a guy!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, the places you'll go!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There is fun to be done!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There are points to be scored.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There are games to be won.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Fame!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll be famous as famous can be, with the whole wide world watching you win on TV.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Except when they don't.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Because, sometimes, they won't.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I'm afraid that some times you'll play lonely games too.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: All alone!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Whether you like it or not, alone will be something you'll be quite a lot.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And when you're alone, there's a very good chance you'll meet things that scare you right out of your pants.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There are some, down the road between hither and yon, that can scare you so much you won't want to go on.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But on you will go though the weather be foul.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: On you will go though your enemies prowl.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: On you will go though the Hakken-Kraks howl.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Onward up many a frightening creek, though your arms may get sore and your sneakers may leak.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: On and on you will hike.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I know you'll hike far and face up to your problems whatever they are.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll get mixed up, of course, as you already know.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You'll get mixed up with many strange birds as you go.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So be sure when you step.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Step with care and great tact and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Just never forget to be dexterous and deft.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And never mix up your right foot with your left.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And will you succeed?

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Yes!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will, indeed!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: (98 and ¾ percent guaranteed.)

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: KID, YOU'LL MOVE MOUNTAINS!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So. . .  be your name Buxbaum or Bixby or Bray or Mordecai Ali Van Allen O'Shea, you're off to Great Places!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Today is your day!

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Your mountain is waiting.

title: OH, THE PLACES YOU'LL GO
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So. . . get on your way!

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Chug, chug, chug.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Puff, puff, puff.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Ding-dong, ding-dong.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The little train rumbled over the tracks.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: She was a happy little train for she had such a jolly load to carry.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Her cars were filled full of good things for boys and girls.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: There were toy animals-giraffes with long necks, Teddy bears with almost no necks at all, and even a baby elephant.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Then there were dolls-dolls with blue eyes and yellow curls, dolls with brown eyes and brown bobbed heads, and the funniest little toy clown you ever saw.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: And there were cars full of toy engines, airplanes, tops, jack-knives, picture puzzles, books, and every kind of thing boys or girls could want.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: But that was not all.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Some of the cars were filled with all sorts of good things for boys and girls to eat-big golden oranges, red-cheeked apples, bottles of creamy milk for their breakfasts, fresh spinach for their dinners, peppermint drops, and lollypops for after-meal treats.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The little train was carrying all these wonderful things to the good little boys and girls on the other side of the mountain.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: She puffed along merrily.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Here comes a shiny new engine, said the funny little clown who jumped out of the train.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Let us ask him to help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: So all the dolls and toys cried out together:

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Please, Shiny New Engine, wont you please pull our train over the mountain?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Our engine has broken down, and the boys and girls on the other side wont have any toys to play with or good food to eat unless you help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: But the Shiny New Engine snorted: l pull you?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I am a Passenger Engine.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I have just carried a fine big train over the mountain, with more cars than you ever dreamed of.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: My train had sleeping cars, with comfortable berths; a dining-car where waiters bring whatever hungry people want to eat; and parlor cars in which people sit in soft arm-chairs and look out of big plate-glass windows.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I pull the likes of you?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Indeed not!

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: And off he steamed to the roundhouse, where engines live when they are not busy.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: How sad the little train and all the dolls and toys felt!

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Then the little clown called out, The Passenger Engine is not the only one in the world.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Here is another engine coming, a great big strong one.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Let us ask him to help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The little toy clown waved his flag and the big strong engine came to a stop.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Please, oh, please, Big Engine, cried all the dolls and toys together.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Won't you please pull our train over the mountain?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Our engine has broken down, and the good little boys and girls on the other side won't have any toys to play with or good food to eat unless you help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: But the Big Strong Engine bellowed: I am a Freight Engine.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I have just pulled a big train loaded with big machines over the mountain.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: These machines print books and newspapers for grown-ups to read.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I am a very important engine indeed.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I wont pull the likes of you!

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: And the Freight Engine puffed off indignantly to the roundhouse.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The little train and all the dolls and toys were very sad.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Cheer up, cried the little toy clown.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The Freight Engine is not the only one in the world.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Here comes another.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: He looks very old and tired, but our train is so little, perhaps he can help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: So the little toy clown waved his flag and the dingy, rusty old engine stopped.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Please, kind Engine, cried all the dolls and toys together.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Won't you please pull our train over the mountain?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Our engine has broken down, and the boys and girls on the other side won't have any toys to play with or good food to eat unless you help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: But the Rusty Old Engine sighed: I am so tired.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I must rest my weary wheels.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I cannot pull even so little a train as yours over the mountain.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I can not.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I can not.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I can not.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Then indeed the little train was very, very sad, and the dolls and toys were ready to cry.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: But the little clown called out, Here is another engine coming, a little blue engine, a very little one, maybe she will help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The very little engine came chug, chugging merrily along.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: When she saw the toy clown's flag, she stopped quickly.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: What is the matter, my friends? she asked kindly.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Oh, Little Blue Engine, cried the dolls and toys.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Will you pull us over the mountain?

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Our engine has broken down and the good boys and girls on the other side won't have any toys to play with or good food to eat, unless you help us.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Please, please, help us, Little Blue Engine.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: She tugged and pulled and pulled and tugged and slowly, slowly, slowly they started off.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The toy clown jumped aboard and all the dolls and the toy animals began to smile and cheer.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Puff, puff, chug, chug, went the Little Blue Engine.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I think I can.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Up, up, up.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Faster and faster and faster and faster the little engine climbed, until at last they reached the top of the mountain.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Down in the valley lay the city.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: Hurray, hurray, cried the funny little clown and all the dolls and toys.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: The good little boys and girls in the city will be happy because you helped us, kind, Little Blue Engine.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: And the Little Blue Engine smiled and seemed to say as she puffed steadily down the mountain, I thought I could.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I thought I could.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I thought I could.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I thought I could.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I thought I could.

title: THE LITTLE ENGINE THAT COULD
author: WATTY PIPER
text: I thought I could.

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: In the great green room there was a telephone

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a red balloon

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a picture of – the cow jumping over the moon.

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And there were three little bears sitting on chairs

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And two little kittens

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a pair of mittens

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a little toy house

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a young mouse

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a comb and a brush and a bowl full of mush

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And a quiet old lady who was whispering hush

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight room

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight moon

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight cow jumping over the moon

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight light and the red balloon

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight bears

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight chairs

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight kittens

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And goodnight mittens

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight clocks

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And goodnight socks

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight little house

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And goodnight mouse

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight comb

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And goodnight brush

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight nobody

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight mush

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: And goodnight to the old lady whispering hush

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight stars

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight air

title: GOODNIGHT MOON
author: MARGARET WISE BROWN
text: Goodnight noises everywhere

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: A told B and B told C  I'll meet you at the top of the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Whee! said D to E F G I'll beat you to the top of the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: I'll beat you to the top of the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Chicka chica boom boom!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Will there be enough room?

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Here comes H up the coconut tree, and I and J and tag-along K, all on there way up the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Chicka chica boom boom!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Will there be enough room?

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Look who's coming!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: L M N O P!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: And Q R S!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: And T U V!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Still more- W!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: And X Y Z!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: The whole alphabet up the- Oh, no!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Skit scat skoodle doot.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Flip flop flee.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Everybody's running to the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Mamas and papas and uncles and aunts hug their little dears, and then dust their pants.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Next from the pileup skinned-knee D and stubbed toe E and patched up F.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Then comes G all out of breath.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: H is tangled with I.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: j and K are about to cry.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: L is knotted like a tie.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: M is looped.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: N is stooped.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: O is twisted alley-oop.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Skit scat skoodle doot.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Flip flop flee.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Look who's coming!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: It's black eyed P, Q R S, and loose-tooth T.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Then U V W wiggle-jiggle free.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Last to come X Y Z.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: And the sun goes down on the coconut tree. . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: But- chick chicka boom boom!

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Look, there's a full moon.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: A is out of bed, and this is what he said, Dare double dare, you can't catch me.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: I'll beat you to he top of the coconut tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA BOOM BOOM
author: BILL MARTIN
text: Chicka chica boom boom!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Someone new is at our house.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Do you know who it is?

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: It's our baby!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm a big sister now!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: The baby is so little.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Too little to walk.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Too little to talk.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Too little to play with toys.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Too little to eat pizza or apples or ice cream.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Babies like to drink milk.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: They like to sleep.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: They like to be warm and cozy.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Our baby likes to look at me.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Look at me, baby.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm your big sister.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Can I hold our baby?

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I must ask Mommy first!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I am gentle with the baby.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I sing a little baby song.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm a big sister-I can make our baby warm and cozy.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Sometimes the baby cries.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Daddy says, Babies cry to tell us something.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Let's see what's the matter.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Oh, it's time to change the baby's diaper.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: It's time for a bottle, too.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I can help- I'm a big sister now.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Mommy and Daddy show me pictures.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Pictures of me when I was a baby.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I was little, too- just like our baby.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Now I am big!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: It's fun being big.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I can walk.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I can talk.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I can play with toys.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I can eat pizza and apples and ice cream!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Mommy loves me.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: Daddy loves me.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I am special to them.

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm the only me in the whole world!

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm special in a new way, too-

title: I'M A BIG SISTER
author: JOANNA COLE
text: I'm a big sister now!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I am Sam.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That Sam-I-am!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That Sam-I-am!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like that Sam-I-am!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Do you like green eggs and ham?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them Sam-I-am.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like green eggs and ham.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Would you like them here or there?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: I would not like them anywhere.

text: I do not like green eggs and ham.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a box.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Eat them!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Here they are.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You may like them.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will see.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You may like them in a tree!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Not in a tree!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Say!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: In the dark?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Here in the dark?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Would you, could you, in the dark?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I would not, could not in the dark.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Would you, could you, in the rain?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I would not, could not, in the rain.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in the dark.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not on a train.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a car.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a tree.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them, Sam, you see.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a house.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a box.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Not with a mouse.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM

text: Not with a fox.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not eat them here or there.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them anywhere!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You do not like green eggs and ham?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them, Sam-I-am.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Could you, would you, with a goat.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I would not, could not, with a goat.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Would you, could you, on a boat?

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I could not, would not, on a boat.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not, will not, with a goat.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not eat them in the rain.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not eat them on a train.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in the dark!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a tree!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in a car!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You let me be!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them in a box.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them with a fox.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not eat them in a house.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not eat them with a mouse.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them here or there.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them ANYWHERE!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like green eggs and ham!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not like them, Sam-I-am.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You do not like them.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So you say.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Try them!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Try them!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And you may.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Try them and you may, I say.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Sam!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: If you will let me be, I will try them.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will see.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Say!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I like green eggs and ham!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I like them, Sam-I-am!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I would eat them in a boat.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I would eat them with a goat. . .

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I will eat them in the rain.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And in the dark.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And on a train.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And in a car.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And in a tree.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They are so good, so good, you see!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So I will eat them in a box.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I will eat them with a fox.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I will eat them in a house.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I will eat them with a mouse.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I will eat them here and there.

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Say!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will eat them ANYWHERE!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do so like green eggs and ham!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Thank you!

title: GREEN EGGS AND HAM
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Thank you, Sam-I-am!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: This is George.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He lived in the Zoo.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He was a good little monkey and always very curious.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He wanted to find out what was going on outside the Zoo.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: One day, when the keeper was not paying attention, George got hold of the key for the cage.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: When the keeper discovered what had happened, it was too late- George was gone!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: WHERE WAS GEORGE?

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: They looked for him everywhere.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But they could not find him.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George was hiding in the hay of his friend, the elephant.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Finally the keepers gave up looking for him.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George found a nice cozy spot to sleep under the elephant's right ear, and the next morning, before the zoo opened, he got away safely.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Once on the street George felt a little scared.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: What should he do in the big city?

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Maybe he could find his friend, the man with the yellow hat, who had brought him over from Africa a long time ago.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Only George did not know where he lived.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: There was a bus stopping at the corner.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George had never ridden on one.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Quickly he climbed a lamp post, jumped on top of the bus and off they went.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Now they were right at the center of the town.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: There was so much to see that George did not know where to look first.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: If only he could go on riding this forever!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But after a while George got tired and a little dizzy.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: When the bus slowed down to turn into a side street, George jumped off.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: There was a restaurant right in front of him.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Mmmm- something smelled good!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Suddenly George felt very hungry.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The kitchen door stood open and George walked in.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: On the table was a big pot.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Of course George was curious.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He had to find out what was in it. . .

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: When the cook came back he had a big surprise.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Spaghetti was all over the place and in the middle of it was a little monkey.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George had been eating yards and yards and had wound himself all up in it.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The cook was a kind man and did not scold much.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But George had to clean up the kitchen and then do all the dishes.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: My, what a lot of them there were!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The cook was watching George.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: You are lucky to have four hands,  he said

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: You can do things twice as quickly.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I have a friend who could use a handy little fellow like you to wash windows.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: If you would like to, I will take you over to him.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: So they went down into the subway and took an uptown train to the cook's friend, who was an elevator man in a skyscraper.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Sure, I cam use you! the elevator man said to George.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I will give you what you need for the job.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: You can start right away.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But remember- you are here for washing windows.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Never mind what people inside the house are doing.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Don't be curious or you'll get into trouble.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George promised to be good, but little monkeys sometimes forget. . .

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George was ready to start.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: My, how many windows there were!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But George got ahead quickly, since he worked with all four hands.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He jumped from window to window just as he had jumped from tree to tree in the African jungle.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: For a while George stuck to his work and did not pay any attention to the people inside.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Of course he was curious, but he remembered his promise.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: In one room a little boy was crying because he did not want to eat his spinach.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George did not even look but went on with his work.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: In another room a man was taking a nap and snoring.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George was sorry it was not his friend, the man with the yellow hat.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He listened to the funny noise for a while, then went on working.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But what was going on here?

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George stopped working and pressed his nose against the window.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Two painters were working inside.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George was fascinated.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Painting looked like a lot more fun than washing windows!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The painters were ready to go out for lunch.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The minute they left George climbed inside.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: What wonderful paints and brushes they had!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George could not resist. . .

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: An hour later the painters came back.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: They opened the door- and stood with their mouths wide open.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The whole room had changed to a jungle with palm trees all over the walls and a giraffe and two leopards and a zebra.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: And a little monkey was busy painting himself on one of the trees!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Then the painters knew what had happened!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Luckily George was close to a door.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He ran out as fast as he could.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: After him ran the two painters, then the elevator man and then the woman who lived in the place.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Oh, my lovely room, my lovely room! cried the woman.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Don't let him her away!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George headed for the fire escape.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George reached the end of the fire escape.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The others had not caught up with him yet.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Here was his chance.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: They could not jump!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But George could easily jump down and escape.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: In a moment he would be safe!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Poor little George!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He had forgotten that the pavement was hard as stone. . .  not like the soft grass of the jungle.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Too bad!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The fall broke his leg and an ambulance came to take George to the hospital.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He got what he deserved! said the woman making my apartment into a jungle, indeed!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I told him he would get into trouble, the elevator man added.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He was too curious.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George had to lie in bed with his leg high up in a plaster cast.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He was very unhappy.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: And it had all started out so nicely!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: If only he had not been so curious he could have had a lot of fun.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Now it was too late. . .

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: But the next morning George's friend, the man with the big yellow hat, was buying a newspaper.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Suddenly he got very excited.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: This is George! he shouted when he saw the picture on the front page.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Quickly he read the whole story and then ran to a telephone booth to ring a hospital.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I am George's friend, he said to the nurse who answered the telephone.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Please take good care of him so that he will get better quickly.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I want to take him to a movie studio and make a picture about his life in the jungle.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Don't let him get into any more mischief until I can take him away.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Finally the day came when George could walk again.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Your friend is going to take you away this morning said the nurse.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Just wait right here for him and don't touch anything!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: As soon as George was alone he looked around at the strange hospital things.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: I wonder what is in that big blue bottle,  he thought.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: And this is how the man with the yellow hat found George when he came to call for him!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: They picked him up and shook him but they could not wake him up.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He was so fast asleep that finally they had to put him UNDER THE SHOWER!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: How surprised his was when he woke up!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: George said goodbye to the nurse and the kind doctor,

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Then he and the man with the yellow hat got into the car to drive to the movie studio.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: In the president's office George had to sign a contract.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Now he was a movie actor!

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: In the studio George was kept so busy all the time that he forgot to be curious,

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He liked the jungle they made for him and played happily there.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: And when the movie was finally finished George invited all his friends to see it: the doctor and the nurse and the ambulance driver and the man from the newsstand and the woman and the elevator man and the two painters and the cook and the reporter and all the keepers of the Zoo.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: Now the lights went out and the picture started.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: This is George, the voice began.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He lived in the jungle.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: He was a good little monkey- he had only one fault: he was too curious.

title: CURIOUS GEORGE TAKES A JOB
author: H.A. RAY
text: The End.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Ooooo!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: A hot dog!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yummy!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yummy!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yummy!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Aaaaaahhh. . .

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: May I help you?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Is that a hot dog?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Not a hot dog; my hot dog.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Aaaaaahhh. . .

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I have a question.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I've never had a hot dog before. . . . What do they taste like?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Well, they are a taste sensation.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Each morsel is a joy!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: A celebration in a bun!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: If you've never experienced the splendor of a hot dog, you should really. . . wait a second.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: This hot dog is mine.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I found it!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Of course!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Enjoy!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Go ahead.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Aaaaaahhh. . .

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Would you say that it tastes like chicken?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Can you believe this guy!?!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: What. . .?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: It just tastes like a hot dog, okay!?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Okay!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Okay!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: So, it doesn't taste like chicken, then?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Oh, for Pete's sake!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Hey, I'm a curious bird.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: That's it!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: It's my hot dog, right!?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Mine!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Mine!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Mine!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: This is unbelievable!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Finders, keepers, is what I say!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I'm a curious bird!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: What do they taste like?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Blah, blah, blah!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yeah, right!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I can't take it anymore!

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: What am I supposed to do?

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I think I've got an idea.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: You know, you're pretty smart for a duckling.

title: THE PIGEON FINDS A HOT DOG!
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Hmmm. . . needs mustard.

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

author: PENNY DALE
text: Chugga!

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE
text: Chugga!

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE
text: Calling Dinosaur Rescue.

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE
text: Dinosaur Rescue, please come quickly!

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE
text: Help!

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

text: Rescue dinosaurs rushing.

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

text: Rushing to get there in time.

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE

text: To get there in time, before it's too late!

title: DINOSAUR RESCUE
author: PENNY DALE
text: Wee-ooo!

author: PENNY DALE
text: Wee-ooo!

text: Waving by the track.

text: By the track to stop the train.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: One day down on the farm, Duck got a wild idea.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: I bet I could ride a bike! he thought.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: He waddled over to where the boy parked his bike, climbed on, and began to ride.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: At first he rode very slowly, and he wobbled a lot, but it was fun.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Duck rode past Cow and waved to her.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: 'Hello, Cow! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: M-o-o-o, said Cow.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what she thought was, A duck on a bike?

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: That's the silliest thing I've ever seen!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Then Duck rode past Sheep.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Sheep! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: B-a-a-a, said Sheep.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what she thought was, He's going to hurt himself if he's not careful!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Duck was riding better now.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: He rode past Dog.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Dog! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Woof! said Dog.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what he thought was, That is a mighty neat trick!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Then Duck rode past Cat.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Cat! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Meow, said Cat.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what she thought was, I wouldn't waste my time riding a bike!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Duck pedaled a little faster.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: He rode past Horse.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Horse! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Ne-e-e-igh! said Horse.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what he though was, You're still not as fast as me, Duck!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Duck rang his bell as he rode toward chicken.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Chicken! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Cluck! Cluck! said Chicken.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what she thought was, Watch where you're going, Duck!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Then Duck rode past Goat.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Goat! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: M-a-a-a, Said Goat.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what he thought was, I'd like to eat that bike!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Duck stood on the seat and rode past Pig and Pig.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Pigs! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Oink said Pig and Pig.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what they thought was, Duck is such a show-off!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Then Duck rode no-hands past Mouse.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Hello, Mouse! said Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Squeak, said Mouse.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: But what he thought was, I wish I could ride a bike just like Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Suddenly, a whole bunch of kids came down the road on bikes.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: They were in such a hurry that they didn't see Duck.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: They parked their bikes by the house and went inside.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Now all the animals had bikes!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: They rode around and around the barnyard.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: This is fun! they all said.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Good idea, Duck!

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: Then they put the bikes back by the house.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: And no one knew that on that afternoon, there had been a cow, a sheep, a dog, a cat, a horse, a chicken, a goat, two pigs, a mouse, and a duck on a bike.

title: DUCK ON A BIKE
author: DAVID SHANNON
text: The End

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Harry was a white dog with black spots who liked everything, except . . . getting a bath.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: So one day when he heard the water running in the tub, he took the scrubbing brush . . . and buried it in the backyard.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Then he ran away from home.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He played where they were fixing the street and got very dirty.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He played at the railroad and got even dirtier.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He played tag with other dogs and became dirtier still.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He slid down a coal chute and got the dirtiest of all.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: In fact, he changed from a white dog with black spots to a black dog with white spots.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Although there were many other things to do, Harry began to wonder if his family thought that he had really run away.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He felt tired and hungry too, so without stopping on the way he ran back home.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: When Harry got to his house, he crawled through the fence and sat looking at the back door.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: One of the family looked out and said, There's a strange dog in the backyard . . . by the way, has anyone seen Harry?

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: When Harry heard this, he tired very hard to show them he was Harry.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He started to do all his old, clever tricks.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He flip-flopped and he flop-flipped.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He rolled over and played dead.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He danced and he sang.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He did these tricks over and over again, but everyone shook their heads and said, Oh no, it couldn't be Harry.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Harry gave up and walked slowly toward the gate, but suddenly he stopped.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He ran to a corner of the garden and started to dog furiously.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Soon he jumped away from the hole barking short, happy barks.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He's found the scrubbing brush!

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: And carrying it in his mouth, he ran into the house.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He jumped into the bathtub and sat up begging, with the scrubbing brush in his mouth, a trick he certainly had never done before.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: This little doggie wants a bath! cried the little girl, and her father said, Why don't you and your brother give him one?

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Harry's bath was the soapiest one he'd ever had.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: It worked like magic.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: As soon as the children started to scrub, they began shouting, Mummy! Daddy! Look, look! Come quick!

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: It's Harry! It's Harry! It's Harry! they cried.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: Harry wagged his tail and was very, very happy.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: His family combed and brushed him lovingly, and he became once again a white dog with black spots.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: It was wonderful to be home.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: After dinner, Harry fell asleep in his favorite place, happily dreaming of how much fun it had been getting dirty.

title: HARRY THE DIRTY DOG
author: GENE ZION
text: He slept so soundly, he didn't even feel the scrubbing brush he'd hidden under his pillow.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: How does a dinosaur say good night when Papa comes in to turn off the light?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does a dinosaur slam his tail and pout?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does he throw his teddy bear all about?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does a dinosaur stomp his feet on the floor and shout: I want to hear one book more!?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does a dinosaur roar?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: How does a dinosaur say good night when Mama comes in to turn off the light?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does he swing his neck from side to side?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does he up and demand a piggyback ride?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does he mope, does he moan, does he silk, does he sigh?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Does he fall on top of his covers and cry?

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: No, dinosaurs don't.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They don't even try.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They give a big kiss.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They turn out the light.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They tuck in their tails.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They whisper, Good night!

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: They give a big hug, then give one kiss more.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Good night.

title: HOW DO DINOSAURS SAY GOOD NIGHT?
author: JANE YOLEN & MARK TEAGUE
text: Good night, little dinosaur.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly loved school.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She loved the pointy pencils.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She loved the squeaky chalk.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And she loved the way her boots went clickety-clickety-click down the long, shiny hallways.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly loved the privacy of her very own desk.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Mine!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She loved the fish sticks and chocolate milk every Friday in the lunchroom.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Straws make everything taste better!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And most of all, she loved her teacher, Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: For you!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Mr. Slinger was as sharp as a tack.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: He wore artistic shirts.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: He wore glasses on a chain around his neck.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And he wore a different colored tie for each day of the week.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Listen up!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow, said Lilly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That was just about all she could say.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Instead of Greetings, students or Good morning pupils, Mr. Slinger winked and said, Howdy!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: He thought that desks in rows were old-fashioned and boring.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Do you rodents think you can handle a semicircle?

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And he always provided the most tasty snacks-things that were curly and crunchy and cheesy.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I want to be a teacher when I grow up, said Lilly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Me, too! said her friends Chester and Wilson and Victor.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: At home Lilly pretended to be Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I am the teacher, she told her baby brother, Julius.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Listen up!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly even wanted her own set of deluxe picture encyclopedias.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Teachers know everything!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: What's with Lilly? asked her mother.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I thought she wanted to be a surgeon or an ambulance driver or a diva, said her father.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: It must be because of her new teacher, Mr. Slinger, said her mother.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow, said he father.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That was just about all he could say.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Whenever the students had free time, they were permitted to go to the Lightbulb Lab in the back of the classroom.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: They expressed their ideas creatively through drawing and writing.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly went often.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She had a lot of ideas.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She drew pictures of Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And she wrote stories about him, too.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: During Sharing Time, Lilly showed her creations to the entire class.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That was just about all he could say.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Big Friendly Mr. Nice Man Teacher!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And at the very last second Mr. Slinger saved the cold, starving, elderly . . .

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: When Mr. Slinger had bus duty, Lilly stood in line even though she didn't ride the bus.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly raised her hand more than anyone else in class (even if she didn't know the answer).

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Call on me!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Please!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Please!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And she volunteered to stay after school to clap erasers.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I want to be a teacher when I grow up, said Lilly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Excellent choice, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: One Monday morning Lilly came to school especially happy.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She had gone shopping with her Grammy over the weekend.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly had a new pair of movie star sunglasses, complete with glittery diamonds and a chain like Mr. Slinger's.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She had three shiny quarters.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And, best of all, she had a brand new purple plastic purse that played a jaunty tune when it was opened.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly wanted to show everyone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Not now, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Listen to our story.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly had a hard time listening.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly really wanted to show everyone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Not now, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Let's be considerate of our classmates.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly had a hard time being considerate.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly really, really wanted to show everyone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Not now, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wait until recess or Sharing Time.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: But Lilly could not wait.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She's in trouble.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: The glasses were so glittery.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: The quarters were so shiny.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And the purse played such nice music, not to mention how excellent it was for storing school supplies.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Look, Lilly whispered fiercely.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Look, everyone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Look what I've got!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Everyone looked.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Including Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: He was not amused.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I'll just keep your things at my desk until the end of the day, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: They'll be safe there, and then you can take them home.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly's stomach lurched.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She felt like crying.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Her glasses were gone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Her quarters wert gone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Her purple plastic Purse was gone.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly longed for her purse all morning.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
