text: She was even too sad to eat the snack Mr. Slinger served before recess.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That afternoon Lilly went to the Lightbulb Lab.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She was still very sad.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She thought and she thought and she thought.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And then she became angry.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She thought and she thought and she thought some more.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And then she became furious.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She thought and she thought and she thought a bit longer.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And then she drew a picture of Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Big Fat Mean Mr. Stealing Teacher!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Bad

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Claws

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Thief

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Bad

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wanted By F.B.I.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: P.S. I do not want to be a teacher when I grow up!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Right before the last bell rang, Lilly sneaked the drawing into Mr. Slinger's book bag.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: When all the students were buttoned and zipped and snapped and tied and ready to go home, Mr. Slinger strolled over to Lilly and gave her purple plastic purse back.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: It's a beautiful purse, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Your quarters are nice and jingly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And those glasses are absolutely fabulous.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: You may bring them back to school as long as you don't disturb the rest of the class.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I do not want to be a teacher when I grow up, Lilly said as she marched out of the classroom.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: On the way home Lilly opened her purse.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Her glasses and quarters were inside.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And so was a note from Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: It said: Today was a difficult day.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Tomorrow will be better.'

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: There was also a small bag of tasty snacks at the bottom of the purse.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly's stomach lurched.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She felt like crying.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She felt simply awful.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly ran all the way home and told her mother and father everything.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Instead of watching her favorite cartoons, Lilly decided to sit in the uncooperative chair.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I'll stay here a million years for Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Why does everything always happen to me?

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: One thousand fifty-one, one thousand fifty-two, one thousand ninety-nine . . .

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That night Lilly drew a new picture of Mr. Slinger and wrote a story about him, too.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly was really really sorry.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: So everyone forgave her.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Even her parents.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Even her stinky baby brother.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Even her especially incredible teacher.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And then the sun shined its smiley face down on everyone and everything.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Even the bugs and the worms.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: The end

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Listen up!!!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I forgive everyone!!!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Kind

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Good

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Nice

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Could be principal

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I am really really really really really really really sorry!!!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Worms

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Bugs

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Oops

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I'm an author!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: How could be resist my no-frills cheese balls?

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: What does it say?

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly's mother wrote a note.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And Lilly's father baked some tasty snacks for Lilly to take to school the next day.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I think Mr. Slinger will understand, said Lilly's mother.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: I know he will, said Lilly's father.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: The next morning Lilly got to school early.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: These are for you, Lilly said to Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Because I'm really really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really sorry.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Mr. Slinger read the story.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And he looked at the picture.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And he read the note.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: What does it say?

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And he sampled the snacks.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Yum Yum

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That was just about all he could say.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: What do you think we should do with this? asked Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Could we just throw it away? asked Lilly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Excellent idea, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: It's like having an extra pocket with a radio inside!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Three quarters are even better than a dollar bill because they make noise!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Glamorous protection from harmful rays!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: During sharing Time, Lilly demonstrated the many uses and unique qualities of her purple plastic purse, her shiny quarters, and her glittery movie star sunglasses.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Then she did a little performance using them as props.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: It's called Interpretive Dance, said Lilly.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Mr. Slinger joined in.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow, said the entire crass.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That was just about all they could say.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Throughout the rest of the day, Lilly's purse and quarters and sunglasses were tucked safely inside her desk.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: She peeked at them often but did not disturb a soul.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Hooray for Mr. Slinger!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Yippee!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: No-frills cheese balls!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Delish!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Wow!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Goodies!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Right before the last bell rang, Mr. Slinger served Lilly's snacks, to everyone's delight.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: What do you want to be when you grow up? asked Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: A TEACHER! everyone responded.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly's response was the loudest.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Excellent choice, said Mr. Slinger.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: As the pupils filed out of the classroom, Lilly held her purple plastic purse close to her heart.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Mr. Slinger was right- it had been a better day.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Lilly ran and skipped and hopped and flew all the way home, she was so happy.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: And she really did want to be a teacher when she grew up.

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Accident!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Accident!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Whoo!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Whooooo!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: That is, when she didn't want to be a dancer or a surgeon or an ambulance driver or a diva or a pilot or a hairdresser or a scuba diver . . .

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Hold still!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: The doctor's here!

title: LILLY'S PURPLE PLASTIC PURSE
author: KEVIN HENKES
text: Ready for takeoff!

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama reads a story with his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama kisses baby's hair.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama goes downstairs.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama feels alone without his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama wants a drink.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama's at the kitchen sink.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama calls down to his llama mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama says she'll be up soon.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama hums a tune.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama waiting waiting for his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama isn't coming yet.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama starts to fret.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama whimpers softly for his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama hears the phone.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama starts to moan. . . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama listens, quiet, for his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: What is Mama Llama doing?

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama starts boo hoo-ing.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama hollers loudly for his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama stomps and pouts.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama jumps and shouts.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama in the dark without his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Eyes wide open, covers drawn. . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: What if Mama Llama's Gone?

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama weeping, wailing for his mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Will his mama ever come?

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama, RUN RUN RUN!

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama, what a tizzy!

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Sometimes Mama's very busy.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Please stop all this llama drama and be patient for your mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Little Llama don't you know, Mama Llama loves you so?

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama's always near, even if she's not right here.

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama red pajama gets two kisses from his mama, snuggles pillow soft and deep. . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA RED PAJAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Baby Llama goes to sleep.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Maisy likes going to the library.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: She loves to read a book in a nice, quiet place.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Today, Maisy wanted to read a book about fish.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: She found a blue book about birds.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: And she found an orange stripy book about tigers, but no fish.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: So Maisy kept looking.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: There are lots of other things to do in the library, too.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Use the computer.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Listen to music.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Make copies of your favorite picture.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: And look at fish in the aquarium.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Aquarium?

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: That's it!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: So Maisy looked by the aquarium.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: That's where she found a book about fish.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: It was sparkly!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Maisy sat down to read her book in a quiet corner.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Then Cyril and Tallulah came along.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Tallulah made a funny face, and they started laughing!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Then Eddie came in.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Story time! he shouted.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Ostrich was going to tell a story in the story corner. . .

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Maisy's quiet corner!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: There was an old woman who swallowed a fly, Ostrich began.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Charley started laughing.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: She swallowed a dog to catch the cat! Ostrich read.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Now everyone was laughing!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Woof-woof!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Ha-ha-ha!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Meow!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: They were still laughing when they checked out their book and went outside to play.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: In the park, Cyril and Charley pretended to be the old woman and her dog.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Woof-woof!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Tallulah meowed like a cat, and Eddie neighed like a horse.

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Meow!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Neigh!

title: MAISY GOES TO THE LIBRARY
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: And Maisy read her sparkly book about fish in a nice, quiet place.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: This is Olivia.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She is good at lot of things.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She is very good at wearing people out.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She even wears herself out.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia has a little brother named Ian.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: He's always copying.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Sometimes Ian just won't leave her alone, so Olivia has to be firm.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia lives with her mother, her father, her brother, her dog, Percy, and Edwin, the cat.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: In the morning, after she gets up, and moves the cat, and brushes her teeth, and combs her ears, and moves the cat, Olivia gets dressed.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She has to try on everything.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: On sunny days, Olivia likes to go to the beach.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She feels it's important to come prepared.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Last summer when Olivia was little, her mother showed her how to make sandcastles.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She got pretty good.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Sometimes Olivia likes to bask in the sun.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: When her mother sees that she's had enough, they go home.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Every day Olivia is supposed to take a nap.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: It's time for your you-know-what, her mother says.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Of course Olivia's not at all sleepy.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: On rainy days, Olivia likes to go to the museum.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She heads straight for her favorite picture.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia looks at it for a long time.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: What could she be thinking?

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But there is one painting Olivia just doesn't get.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I could do that in about five minutes, she says to her mother.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: As soon as she gets home she gives it a try.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Time out.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: After a nice bath, and a nice dinner, it's time for bed.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But of course Olivia's not at all sleepy.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Only five books tonight, Mommy, she says.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: No, Olivia, just one.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: How about four?

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Two.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Three.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Oh, all right, three. But that's it!

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: When they've finished reading, Olivia's mother gives her a kiss and says, You know, you really wear me out.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But I love you anyway.

title: OLIVIA
author: IAN FALCONER
text: And Olivia gives her a kiss back and says, I love you anyway too.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: There was trouble in the big tree house down a sunny dirt road deep in Bear Country- trouble with manners.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: The Bear family's trouble with manners was that they forgot them!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: At first it was just an occasional please or thank you that was forgotten.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Then there was a rude push without an excuse me.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Then a reach across the table instead of a please pass the broccoli.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Mama Bear wasn't quite sure how or why it happened.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But she was sure of one thing– whatever the reason, the Bear family had become a pushing, shoving, name-calling, ill-mannered mess!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Sillyhead!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Fuzzbrain!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Noodlepuss!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: At the table it was even worse.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: They were a grabbing, mouth-stuffing, food-fighting, kicking-under-the-table super mess!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Of course, Mama Bear tried to correct Brother and Sister Bear's behavior.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: She tried coaxing.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: She tried complaining.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: She tried shouting!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: She tried going to Papa for help (though it sometimes seemed to Mama that he was part of the problem).

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Papa banged on the table and shouted as only he could shout.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But nothing really seemed to do any good.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Mama didn't like what was happening to her family.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Not one bit.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Something had to be done.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But what?

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: The best way to fight bad habits, she thought, was with good habits.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Then she thought of a plan.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: She got a big piece of cardboard and a marker.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: At the top she wrote: THE BEAR FAMILY POLITENESS PLAN.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: When the plan was finished, she called a family meeting and showed it to papa and the cubs.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: It certainly got the Bear family's attention!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: The bear family politeness plan

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Rudeness

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Penalty

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Forgetting Please or thank you . . . sweep front steps

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Pushing or shoving . . . beat two rugs

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Interrupting . . . dust downstairs

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Name calling . . . clean cellar

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Reaching at table . . . clean yard

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Playing with food . . . wash dishes

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Rude noises . . . weed garden

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Banging door . . . clean attic

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Forgetting excuse me . . . empty garbage

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Hogging bathroom . . . put out trash

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Mama's plan had a list of all the rude things she wanted to stop.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Beside each one was a penalty-a job or chore that went with it.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: If you forgot a please or a thank you, you had to sweep the front steps.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: If you pushed or shoved, you had to beat two rugs.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: If you got caught name-calling, you had to clean the whole cellar!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But, Mama! sputtered the cubs.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: You're not being fair!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: It seems to me, she said, that you're the ones who aren't being fair-to yourselves or anyone else.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: That's what manners are all about-being fair and considerate.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Manners are very important.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: They help us get along with each other.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Why, without manners-

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Your mama's absolutely right! interrupted Papa.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Thank you, Papa, for your comment.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But interrupting is number three on the Rude List, and the penalty is dusting the downstairs, Mama said, and handed him the feather duster.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Hmm, said Brother.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: This looks serious.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: I think we'd better come up with a plan of our own or we're going to be doing a lot of extra chores.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: What sort of plan? asked Sister.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Well, he said, instead of just being polite, we'll be super polite.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: We'll 'please' and 'thank you' so much that Mama will get fed up and call the whole thing off!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Yes, said Sister.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: We'll be so polite, she won't be able to stand it!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: They put their plan into action.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: They were super polite. . .

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -On the stairs:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: After you, Sister dear!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Thank you, dear Brother!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -In the hall:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Excuse me, Brother dear!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Why, certainly, my dear Sister!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -Waiting for the bathroom:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Terribly sorry to have kept you waiting!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Think nothing of it, my dear!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But it didn't work the way they expected.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Mama didn't get fed up at all.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: And after a while Brother and Sister forgot about being super polite and were just polite. . .

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -At the table:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Pass the honey, please.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Certainly.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -In their room:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Would you like me to help you pick up your toys?

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Thank you very much.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: -in the yard:

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Oops! Sorry-I didn't mean to bump you.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: That's all right.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: No harm done.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: And it turned out that Mama had been right: things did go more smoothly.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Once they got into the good manners habit, they didn't even have to think about it.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But it wasn't so easy for Papa.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: He was the one who got fed up.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: It's a little harder to change habits when you're older, and he had to do quite a few extra chores for forgetting his manners.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: I'm glad to get out of the house, away from that Politeness Plan! he said as he drove the family along the highway on a trip to the supermarket.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Manners and courtesy are just as important away from home- especially on the road, said Mama as they stopped at a stop sign to let pedestrians and other cars pass.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: They help us drive safely.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Well, grumbled Papa as they all went into the busy supermarket, I think you can have too much of a good thing- you've got to have common sense along with manners!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Why if you let everyone go ahead of you at the checkout, you'd be there forever!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: And sometimes you have to interrupt- Excuse me, mad am, he interrupted a shopper, but I believe you have a leaking bottle in your cart!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: The shopper thanked him for his help.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: You see? he said, driving home.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: There's more to life than remembering your manners.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Besides, manners are all right for cubs and mama bears. . .

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: . . .  But we papa bears have other things to think about-

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: At that moment the car in front stopped suddenly and Papa bumped into it.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: He was furious.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Why, that pinheaded fiddlebrain! he snarled.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Name calling! reminded Sister.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: The penalty for name calling was cleaning the whole cellar, so Papa gritted his teeth and remembered his manners.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: And a good thing, too.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Because climbing out of the other car was the biggest, angriest bear he had ever seen!

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: But when the angry bear saw how polite Papa was, he remembered his manners too.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: He explained that he had stopped short because a mama duck and her ducklings had crossed in front of him.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: Then he and Papa Bear looked at their bumpers and saw that no harm had been done.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: As I was saying, said Papa as they continued on their way, it's very important for us to remember our manners at all times- and I want to thank you, Sister, for reminding me to remember mine.

title: THE BERENSTAIN BEARS FORGET THEIR MANNERS
author: STAN & JAN BERENSTAIN
text: You're very welcome, I'm sure, said Sister Bear politely.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: This hat is not mine.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I just stole it.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I stole it from a big fish.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: He was asleep when I did it.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: And he probably won't wake up for along time.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: And even if he does wake up, he probably won't notice that it's gone.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: And even if he does notice that it's gone, he probably won't know it was me who took it.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: And even if he does guess it was me, he won't know where I am going.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: But I will tell you where I am going.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I am going where the plants grow big and tall and close together.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: It is very hard to see in there.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: Nobody will ever find me.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: There is someone who saw me already.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: But he said he wouldn't tell anyone which way I went.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: So I am not worried about that.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I know it's wrong to steal a hat.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I know it does not belong to me.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: But I am going to keep it.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: It was too small for him anyway.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: It fits me just right.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: And look!

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I made it!

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: There the plants are big and tall and close together.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: I knew I was going to make it.

title: THIS IS NOT MY HAT
author: JON KLASSEN
text: Nobody will ever find me.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: There used to be an alligator under my bed.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: When it was time to go to sleep, I had to be very careful because I knew he was there.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: But whenever I looked, he hid. . .  or something.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: So I'd call Mom and Dad.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: But they never saw it.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: It was up to me.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I just had to do something about that alligator.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: So I went to the kitchen to get some alligator bait.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I filled a paper bag full of things alligators like to eat.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I put a peanut butter sandwich, some fruit, and the last piece of pie in the garage.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I put cookies down the hall.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I left fresh vegetables on the stairs.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I put a soda and some candy next to my bed.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: Then I watched and waited.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: Sure enough, out he came to get something to eat.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: Then I hid in the hall closet.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I followed him down the stairs.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I followed him down the hall.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: When he crawled into the garage, I slammed the door and locked it.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: Then I went to bed.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: There wasn't even any mess to clean up.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: Now that there is an alligator in the garage, I wonder if my dad will have any trouble getting in his car tomorrow morning.

title: THERE'S AN ALLIGATOR UNDER MY BED
author: MERCER MAYER
text: I'll just leave him a note.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: In the light of the moon a little egg lay on a leaf.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: One Sunday morning the warm sun came up and-pop!-out of the egg came a tiny and very hungry caterpillar.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: He started to look for some food.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Monday, he ate through one apple.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: But he was still hungry.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Tuesday he ate through two pears, but he was still hungry.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Wednesday he ate through three plums, but he was still hungry.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Thursday he ate through four strawberries, but he was still hungry.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Friday he ate through five oranges, but he was still hungry.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: On Saturday he ate through one piece of chocolate cake, one ice-cream cone, one pickle, one slice of Swiss cheese, one slice of salami, one lollipop, one piece of cherry pie, one sausage, one cupcake and one slice of watermelon.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: That night he had a stomachache!

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: The next day was Sunday again.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: The caterpillar ate through one nice green leaf, and after that he felt much better.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Now he wasn't hungry anymore- and he wasn't a little caterpillar any more.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: He was a big, fat caterpillar.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: He built a small house, called a cocoon, around himself.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: He stayed inside for more than two weeks.

title: THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Then he nibbled a hole in the cocoon, pushed his way out and . . . he was a beautiful butterfly!

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Not so long ago, before she could even speak words, Trixie went on an errand with her daddy.. . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Trixie and her daddy went down the block, through the park, past the school, and into the Laundromat.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Trixie helped her daddy put the laundry into the machine.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: She even got to put the money into the machine.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Then they left.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: But a block or so later . . . Trixie realized something.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Trixie turned to her daddy and said, Aggle flaggle klabble!

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: That's right, replied her daddy.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: We're going home.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Aggle flaggle klabble! Said Trixie again.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Blaggle plaggle!

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Wumby flappy?!

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Snurp.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Now, please don't get fussy, said her daddy.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Well, she had no choice . . . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: She went boneless.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: She did everything she could to show how unhappy she was.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: By the time they got home, her daddy was unhappy, too.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: As soon as Trixie's mommy opened the door, she asked, Where's Knuffle Bunny?

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: The whole family ran down the block.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And they ran through the park.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: They zoomed past the school, and into the Laundromat.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Trixie's daddy looked for Knuffle Bunny.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And looked . . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And looked . . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And looked . . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: But Knuffle Bunny was nowhere to be found.. . .

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: So Trixie's daddy decided to look harder.

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Until . . . Knuffle Bunny!!!

title: KNUFFLE BUNNY
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And those were the first words Trixie ever said.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: We're finally here! declares Lulu as she jumps out of the car and spreads her wings.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I love the beach! says Lulu.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: You've never even been to the beach before, replied her big brother.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: But I already know that I love it, she says.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: And I can't wait to go swimming in the waves!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: The sand feels warm under her feet as Lulu and Bingo lead the family to a good spot to spread their blanket.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu runs to the edge of the water.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: The ocean goes on and on, and makes huge roaring sounds.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She had no idea it was going to be so big and noisy.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She takes a few steps backward.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Bingo barks at the waves.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Are you going in? he brother yells, running past her and splashing into the water.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I don't think so, she says.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Um . . .  I really came here to build sand castles.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu retreats to the beach blanket to find her trusty pail and shovel.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She builds a giant sand castle, and uses little sticks for people.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: The King and the Queen are very happy here, she thinks.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Bingo digs a moat to keep them extra safe.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu walks over and sits down next to her mama.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She looks out at the ocean, which is glittering with light.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She thinks it looks pretty from far away.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Do you want to go into the water? asks Mama.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: No, Lulu says, I want to fly the kite now.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Soon the kite is darting back and forth in the wind, but Lulu holds on tight.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: After the wind dies down, it feels really hot.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu glances at the ocean.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She thinks the water would be cool, but the waves still look much too big.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: This is a good time to remind her parents about ice cream.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu lists all her top eleven favorite flavors: Chocolate Marshmallow, Cherry Vanilla, Pistachio, Butter Pecan, Peppermint Bon Bon, Peanut Butter Chip, Raspberry Swirl, Peach Pie, Almond Fudge, Royal Banana Surprise, and . . . vanilla.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: At the ice cream stand Lulu can't just choose one.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: This is a day for a double scoop, her mama says.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Sometimes mamas can be very right.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Come on, Bingo, says Lulu after she finishes her ice cream.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Let's take a walk down the beach!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: They find a long piece of driftwood.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu writes Loopy L's in the sand, and draws pictures of Bingo.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: He's the perfect subject, and stays really still.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: It is very hot.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Lulu looks at the ocean.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Other kids are splashing and jumping in the waves.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She walks down to the edge of the water.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Should we get out feet wet, Bingo? She asks.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She thinks it would be okay to go into the ocean just a little bit.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Suddenly a wave crashes into her legs and nearly knocks her over.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Just as she gets her balance the whirling water races back and tries to pull her in.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Her feet get buried in the sand up to her ankles.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Are you okay, Bingo? Lulu asks.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She looks around to see if anyone notices that they were almost carried away, but everyone is playing just as they were before.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Let's be explorers! says Lulu, brushing the sand off her knees.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: We can collect things for our museum.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: They march off across the beach.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: They hear seagulls that sound like they are laughing, discover little crabs that burrow into the sand, ad pick up slimy seaweed washed up on the shore.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: There are also lots of shells on the beach, all different shapes and sizes.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She chooses the most special one and puts them into her pail.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I know, Bingo!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I bet if we dig, we could find a pirate treasure! says Lulu.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She digs, and digs, and digs.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Finding treasure is hard work.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: When Lulu feels the water splash against her, she spins around.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: The tide has come in!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: It is taking away her favorite pail!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She has to rescue it or it will be lost forever!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: This is a job for Ladybug Girl!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I'll save you! she says, snapping up the pail.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: When she looks down, she realizes she is in the ocean.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: She is actually in the ocean!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: The water is past her knees, and she isn't afraid at all!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Ladybug Girl isn't afraid of anything!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: For the rest of the long afternoon, Ladybug Girl and Bingo splash in the water and run on the beach daring the waves to catch them.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: You can't get me, waves.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I'm Ladybug Girl!

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Ladybug Girl and Bingo play until the bright blue sky turns pink.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: They make footprints in the sand.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: At least 14 miles of them, Ladybug Girl thinks.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Every time the ocean erases them, they make more.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Then it is time to go, and Ladybug Girl trudges back across the still-warm sand.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Bingo follows slowly, dragging his ears.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Standing at the top of the dunes, Ladybug Girl waits for her brother.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: So, did you like your first time at the beach? he asks.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: Yes, she answers.

title: LADYBUG GIRL AT THE BEACH
author: DAVID SOMAN AND JACKY DAVIS
text: I told you, Ladybug Girl loves the beach!

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos McGee was AN Early RISER.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Every morning when the alarm clock clanged, he swung his legs out of bed and swapped his pajamas for a fresh-pressed uniform.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: He would wind his watch and set a pot of water to boil-saying to the sugar bowl, A spoonful for my oatmeal, please, and two for my teacup.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Belly full and ready for the workday, he'd amble out the door.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Every day Amos waited for the number five bus.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Next stop, City Zoo, the bus driver would call.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: 6 a.m. right on time, he'd reply.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos had a lot to do at the zoo, but he always made time to visit his good friends.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: He would play chess with the elephant (who thought and thought before making a move), run races with the tortoise (who never ever lost), sit quietly with the penguin (who was very shy), lend a handkerchief to the rhinoceros (who always had a runny nose), and, at sunset, read stories to the owl (who was afraid of the dark).

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: One Day Amos Awoke with the sniffles, and the sneezes, and the chills.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: He swung his achy legs out of bed, curled them back again and said, Ugh.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: I don't think I'll be going to work today.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Meanwhile AT THE zoo . . .

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The animals waited for their friend.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The elephant arranged his pawns and polished his castles.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The tortoise stretched his legs and limbered up.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The penguin sat patiently, all by himself.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The rhinoceros worried that his allergies were worsening.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The owl perched atop a tall, stack of storybooks, scratching his head with concern.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Where is Amos? the animals wondered.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Later that day. . .

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Hooray!

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: My good friends are here!

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The elephant prepared a game of chess.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos thought and thought before making a move.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: I'm too tired to run races today, said Amos to the tortoise.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Let's play hide-and-seek instead.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The tortoise hid inside his shell.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos hid beneath the covers.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos yawned, I could use a nap.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: The penguin sat quietly, keeping Amos's feet warm.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: I'm beginning to feel much better, thank you, said Amos to his friends.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: He swung his legs out of bed.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Perhaps we'll share a pot of tea.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: Amos wound his alarm clock.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: It's getting late, he said.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: After all, we have a morning bus to catch.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: So Amos said goodnight to the elephant.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: And goodnight to the tortoise.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: And goodnight to the penguin.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: And goodnight to the rhinoceros.

title: A SICK DAY FOR AMOS MCGEE
author: PHILIP C. STEAD
text: And goodnight to the owl, who-knowing that Amos was afraid of the dark-read a story aloud before turning out the light.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: It was late.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Froggy was too pooped to pop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He'd been playing hard at Max's all day long.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: FRROOGGYY! called his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Whaaat?

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: It's time for bed!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: No! cried Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I'm not tired!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Why don't you take a nice bath? she said.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: We'll make it a bubble bath.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But first I have to find my boat!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: -flop flop flop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in the fridge.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Nope!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked beneath the sink.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Not here!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in the laundry bin.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I found it!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And he took a bath-splash splash splash.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Now it's time to Put your pajamas on! said his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And she wrapped him all cozy warm in a towel.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But first I have to find them!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: -flop flop flop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked on his floor.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Nope!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in his toy chest.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Not here!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked behind his desk.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I found them!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And he put them on-zwoop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: FRROOGGYY! called his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Whaaaat?

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: It's time to brush! said his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But first I have to find my toothbrush!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: -flop flop flop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in the fishbowl.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Nope!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in the wastebasket.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Not here!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He looked in the cookie jar.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I found it!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And he brushed his gums-brush brush brush.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: FRROOGGYY! called his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Whaaaat?

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I bet you want your huggy, said his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Yep! said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: I have to find my huggy!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: -flop flop flop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Oh, here it is!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: It's under the stove!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Bonk!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He gave it a hug and climbed into bed.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Now it's time to sleep! said his mother, and gave him a good-night kiss.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But first I need a snack!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Then I'll go to sleep.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And he hopped out of bed-flop flop flop.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Munch scrunch munch.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: He ate a bowl of flies. . .  then crawled back into bed.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Now go to sleep, Froggy! said his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: She was getting a little tired herself.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But I'm thirsty!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And you have to close the closet!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And open my door just a crack!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And turn the night-light down just how I like it!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Then I'll go to sleep!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Oh fiddlesticks! said his mother, and got him a glass of water.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Oops! cried froggy, looking more red in the face than green.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: It spilled!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Oh, Froggy, said his mother.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: She wiped it up. . .

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Then got him another glass of water-glug glug glug.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Closed the closet-slam!

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Opened his door just a crack-creeeak.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And turned down the light just right.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Now go to sleep! she said.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Okay, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: But first . . .

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: will you read me a story?

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Of course, dear.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: She yawned.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And she read. . .

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And she read. . .

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: And she read. . . till the book dropped-thump!-and she fell asleep, snoring like a horse.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Good night, Mom, said Froggy.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Then he closed his eyes and went to sleep-zzzzzzz.

title: FROGGY GOES TO BED
author: JONATHAN LONDON
text: Good night, Froggy! said Mr. Owl, sitting on a branch.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I was putting flowers on the mane of my pet unicorn.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, why are you dropping flowers on the rug? asked Mommy.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I'm not dropping flowers.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I am getting Goldie ready for the Unicorn Ball, I said, prancing around the room.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: What unicorn?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I don't see any unicorn, said Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: She's right here and she's not ANY unicorn, she is my unicorn.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Her name is Goldilicious, Goldie for short.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Oh, Goldie-you shouldn't have done that on the floor!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: You know better.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Just neigh when you need to go to the potty.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I'm sorry, Peter, but you are stepping right in it, I said.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Mommy!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: What is Pinkalicious talking about? whined Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, it's okay to have an imaginary friend, but maybe it's time to put Goldie back in her stall or take her outside the house, where she can run free.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Okay, Mommy.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Come on, Goldie, we know where we aren't wanted, I said, galloping out the door.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I took Goldie out to the perfect her pinkerrific pirouette.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldie is very graceful and has a wonderful sense of balance.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: We were thinking of joining the Majestic Magenta Ballet, but there are only a few extremely special and unique people who can see Goldie, namely, ME!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldie is also a pinkatastic roller skater, kite flyer, and high jumper.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: She is very fast.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I can never keep up with her.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Godieeeeeee, wait for me!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldie, where are you?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: She loves to play hide-and-seek, but she is too quick for me.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: As soon as I spot her, she is gone.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Oh, you turned into a fairy princess and you are having a tea party.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldilicious, this is the most delicious cake I have ever had!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: And where did you ever find this sweet flower nectar? I asked.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, may I join your tea party? Peter asked.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Please, Peter, you are about to sit on Goldie!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Be careful, I scolded.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Here is a little cinnamon stick for your tea, said Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: That is a WORM! Now you have insulted our host.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: You better watch out. . .  because Goldie will always protect me! I shouted.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Not if I kidnap her and hold her prisoner in the castle tower!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Beware, fair sister, or your golden pet will become broth for my magical cauldron, Peter yelled from the tree house.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Don't worry, Goldie, I will rescue you from the Wandering Wizard, I said.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, you must gaze into this crystal ball as I cast a spell, Peter chanted as he threw a ball over the side of the tree house.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Abracadabra, abracadin, wizard out, pirate in!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Ahoy, matey, Goldilicious will never become your treasure!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I will make you walk the plank!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I suddenly realized that Goldilicious was nowhere to be seen.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Hey, Peter, where did she go?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Look, she turned into a mermaid! Peter pointed to Goldilicious.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Oh, that is just her dress-up outfit.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: She's not a real mermaid.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: She is just pretending, I told Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Wow, not only can she float on water, she can float in the air.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldilicious is flying! said Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Come back! I screamed.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Will she come back tomorrow?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: I'm going to find my lasso so I can catch her in the morning when I wake up, said Peter.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: That's if you can find her, I yelled as Peter ran off.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Goldie, where did you go?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Have you become one with the universe?

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, it's time to go to bed.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Come in now, bellowed voices from the door.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Perhaps Goldie is hiding from the mean sorcerers who have come to take me to the dungeon, I said loudly.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Pinkalicious, we heard that.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Oh, pardon me, I meant Sir Daddy and Lady Mommy, rulers supreme and gracious guardians of the Princess of Pink.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: NOW!

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Okay, okay, I'm coming to bed, but I don't know where Goldie is, and she will miss me if I don't pet her good night.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Oh, she was here waiting for me all along! I said, climbing into bed and closing my eyes.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: Sweet dreams.

title: GOLDILICIOUS
author: VICTORIA KANN
text: See you tomorrow, Mommy and Daddy said, kissing us both good night.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: One day, Maisy decided to go camping.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: And all her friends came along.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: They found the perfect place to make a camp.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Pitching a tent is not easy!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: But everyone worked together.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Oh no!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: The tent fell down!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: So they tried again. . .

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: And again. . .

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Until the tent stayed up.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Good job, everyone!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: That night, they sang around the campfire.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Then it was time for bed.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Cyril went in first with flashlight.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: One in the tent!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Next came Charley.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Watch the pegs!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Two in the tent!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Then it was Tallulah's turn.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Three in the tent!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Make room for Maisy!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Four in the tent!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Is there room for one more?
