title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Come on, Eddie!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Oh no!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Five in the. . .  What a squash!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: What a squeeze!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: What a squeezy squish-squash!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Five in the tent!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Good night campers!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Pop!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Out came Cyril.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Pop!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Out came Tallulah.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Pop!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Out came Charley.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Pop!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Out came Maisy.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: One in the tent, four under the stars.

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Sleep tight, campers!

title: MAISY GOES CAMPING
author: LUCY COUSINS
text: Hoot! Hoot!

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: One day Olivia was riding a camel in Egypt. . .

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: When her mother woke her up.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Time to get up, sweetie-pie.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Remember, you have soccer this morning.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia's uniform comes in a really unattractive green.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Mommy, can you make me a red soccer shirt like this one?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Please?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But then you'll look different from everyone else on the team, explained her mother.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: That's the point.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: When Olivia came home from practice, her mother was working on the shirt.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Is it done yet? she asked.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Not yet, said her mother.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia waited, and waited, and waited, till she was too exhausted to wait any longer.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: So she went out to play with the cat.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Look, darling, it's all done! said her mother.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But something was missing.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Wait a second, said Olivia.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Where's my toy?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Where's my toy?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: It was right there on the bed.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I just put it there.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I remember exactly.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: That's my best toy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I need it now!

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Somebody took my best toy!

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Olivia looked everywhere-under the rug, under the sofa, under the cat.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She asked her little brother, Ian, WHAT DID YOU DO WITH MY TOY?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: She asked her baby brother, William, WHAT DID YOU DO WITH MY TOY?

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Wooshee gaga.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: That night, and it was a dark and stormy night, Olivia was practicing her piano when she heard an awful sound.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: The sound got louder and louder.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: It was HORRIBLE, and it was coming from behind the door.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: So, of course, Olivia went inside.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: And that's when she saw it.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: It was. . .  THE DOG!

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: And he'd chewed her toy to bits.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Mommy, Daddy, Mommy, Daddy!

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: It was Perry! cried Olivia.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: He took my best toy and chewed it to bits, and now it's wrecked.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I'm sorry, sweetie-pie, said her mother, but doggies like to chew.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: And he didn't know it was your toy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: My best toy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Don't worry, said Olivia's father.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Tomorrow we'll go get you the very best toy in the whole world.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Oh, thank you, Daddy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: I love you more than anyone.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Still, it was Olivia's best toy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: So she fixed it, adding a bow for extra beauty.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: All better.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: Only books about cats tonight, Mommy.

title: OLIVIA. . . AND THE MISSING TOY
author: IAN FALCONER
text: But even Olivia couldn't stay mad forever.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama, morning light.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Feeling yucky, just not right.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Down to breakfast.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Tiny sneeze.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Sniffle, snuffle.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Tissues, please!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama's head is feeling hot.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama's throat is hurting lots.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Achy, fever, stuffy head. . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama Llama, back to bed.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Time to rest.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: No school today.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama brings a tray.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Fruity medicine tastes yucky!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama Llama's throat feels gucky.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Look around.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Not much to do.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Trucks are boring.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Tractors, too.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Make a tunnel for a train?

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama Llama, fuzzy brain.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama gets a book.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Have a listen.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Take a look.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Heavy eyelids.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Drippy nose.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama Llama starts to doze.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Up again and feeling better.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Draw some pictures.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Make some letters.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama wants a sandwich, please!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama starts to sneeze.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Lunch is over.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Time for toys!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama's head does not like noise.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama makes a big ah-choo!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama's out of things to do.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Uh oh!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama's throat is sore.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Being sick is such a bore.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama coughs, and Llama yawns. . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: How long can this day go on?

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama shnortles, hacks, and wheezes.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama Llama's sick of sneezes!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Soggy tissues, gobs of guck.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Sniffing, snorting, sneezing, yuck!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama, red pajama, sick and bored, at home with Mama.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Wait!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Llama llama knows what's best.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Mama Llama needs a rest!

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Get more tissues.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Bring a cup.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Fluff a comfy pillow up.

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: What else could Mama Llama need?

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: How about some books to read?

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: Just the thing for Llama llama, sick at home. . .

title: LLAMA LLAMA HOME WITH MAMA
author: ANNA DEWDNEY
text: but with his mama.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: So you want a pet train?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Well, of course you do!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Trains make awesome pets-they're fun, playful, and extremely useful.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Lucky for you, this handy guidebook contains everything you need to know to choose, track, and train your very own pet train.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Ready?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Then let's head out and find some trains!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Different trains live in different places.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Freight trains live in the countryside and travel in herds.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Monorail trains live in the city and travel alone.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Early stream engines pretty much just sit in museums.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Have you decided which sort of train you'd like?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Great.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Now you need to catch one.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: There are lots of ways to catch a train.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Some people will corner it.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Others might use a big net to trap it.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Still others will run the track into quicksand.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: True, these methods all work.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: But I'm going to show you the best way. . .

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: First, get up really early in the morning and find a good hiding spot close to some trains.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Now the hard part: sit quietly and wait and wait and wait some more.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: As the sun rises, the trains will begin to stir and start their engines.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Watch them work and play.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: It's only natural that you'll want to take home all the trains but don't just grab the first one you see.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Take your time and choose one that's right for you.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Got one?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Time to make your move: send a puff of smoke high into the air.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Perfect!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: You've got the train's attention!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: If you brought any coal with you, now would be the time to offer it.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Try saying, My what a handsome train you are.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Next, make the call of the wild train: CHUGGA-CHUGGA, CHUGGA-CHUGGA!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: CHOO-CHOO!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Well done!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Here it comes!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: How will you know if the train you caught is THE ONE?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Don't worry.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: You'll know.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Once you get your train home, you'll want to give it a name.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Some popular names are: Milo, Morgan, Nathan, Pushkin, Smokey, Picklepuss, Captain Foofamaloo, Little miss Muffinhead, Sir Chuggsa, and Sparkles.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Of course, you can name your train whatever you like.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Don't worry if it seems shy or scared at first.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: A train needs time to adjust to new surroundings.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: A warm bath can help calm a nervous train. . .  and few trains can resist a good read-aloud.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: If your train has trouble falling asleep at night, play soft locomotion sounds: Rocka-rocka, clickety-clack!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Rocka-rocka, clickety-clack!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: That's an old conductor's trick that'll give a train good dreams.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Spend as much time as you can getting to know your train.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Does it prefer going fast or slow?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Does it like to fetch.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: How does it feel about tunnels and bridges?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Want to teach your train a few tricks?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Easy as pie!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Start with a simple trick. . .  then move on to something a bit harder.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: By now your train should trust you enough to let you ride him. . .  but he may not trust you enough to ride in the engineer's car yet.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Start off in the caboose.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Good manners are important.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Train your train not to leap up on people and to always wipe its wheels before going indoors.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Of course, your train can't go everywhere with you.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Out on the open road, you're sure to pass other kids with their pet trains, planes, trucks, or submarines.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: This is a great chance for both of you to make new friends.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Congratulations!

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: You've given your train fuel, water, a good home, plenty of friendship, and fun- everything it needs to be happy.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: How will you know if your train is happy?

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: Don't worry.

title: HOW TO TRAIN A TRAIN
author: JASON CARTER EATON
text: You'll know.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wheels on the bus go round and round all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The horn on the bus goes beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The horn on the bus goes beep, beep, beep all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wipers on the bus go swish, swish, swish, swish, swish, swish, swish, swish, swish, swish.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wipers on the bus go swish, swish, swish all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The signals on the bus go blink, blink, blink, blink, blink, blink, blink, blink, blink.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The signals on the bus go blink, blink, blink, blink all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The motor on the bus goes zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom, zoom.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The motor on the bus goes zoom, zoom, zoom all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The door on the bus goes open and shut, open and shut, open and shut.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The door on the bus goes open and shut all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The kitties on the bus say, Come on, Pete! Come on, Pete! Come on, Pete!

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The kitties on the bus say, Come on, Pete! all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The driver on the bus says, Move on back! Move on back! Move on back!

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The driver on the bus says, Move on back! all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: Pete's friends on the bus say, Sit with us! Sit with us! Sit with us!

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: Pete's friends on the bus say, Sit with us! all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The back of the bus bumps up and down, up and down, up and down.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The back of the bus bumps up and down all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The kitties on the bus go Pete the Cat, Pete the Cat, Pete the Cat.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The kitties on the bus go Pete the Cat all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The dog on the bus goes woof woof woof, woof woof woof, woof woof woof.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The dog on the bus goes woof woof woof all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The cats on the bus shout, Let's rock out! Let's rock out! Let's rock out!

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The cats on the bus shout, Let's rock out! all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: The wheels on the bus go round and round all day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: All day long.

title: PETE THE CAT: THE WHEELS ON THE BUS
author: JAMES DEAN
text: All day long.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Well, howdy!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Charlie the Ranch Dog here.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: You can just call me Charlie.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Life sure is good out here on the ol' ranch.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: The sun is shining, the kids are playing, the birds are chirping, the cattle are happy. . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: . . . And Mama is rubbing my belly.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I love it when Mama rubs my belly.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Ahhh. . .  Life doesn't get any better than this.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: It's good to be the King of the Ranch!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Snort-HUH?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: What'd I miss?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Where are the kids?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Where's Mama?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Wait, what's that?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: They're carrying a calf!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: What's going on?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: What are they doing?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Wait. . .  they're taking the calf. . .  in the House?!?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: But everyone knows calves don't belong in the house!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I'd better go investigate.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I have now officially seen everything.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Well, this calf does look brand-new.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: She must be a brand-new baby.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Maybe she's lonely.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Maybe she has lost her mama.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Maybe she needs a little tender loving care.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Mama and the kids are perfect for that job!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: They give me tender loving care all the time!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: They scratch my ears. . . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: They feed me lunch. . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: (Lunch is my life.)

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: They spend time with me. . .  and they tuck me into bed at night.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Yep, it's all TLC, all the time for me. . . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Hey!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: That's my blanket!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I've always loved that blanket.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Now they're giving the calf. . .  a bath?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Hmm.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: It's been awhile since I've had one of those.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Wait, where's Mama going?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Maybe she's making me dinner!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Yum.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Dinner is my life.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Wait.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: What?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: HUH?!?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Hark.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Do you hear that sound?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: That's the sound of my stomach growling.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I haven't eaten in a long, long time.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: At least an hour!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I'm so hungry, I could faint.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Hey!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Now they're tucking her in.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: In My bed!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: That's exactly how they tuck me in!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Boy, that soft bed of mine sure does look comfy.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Is it bedtime already?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: But what about my bed?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: What?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: I have to sleep on the floor?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Oh, no.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Say it ain't so.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Oh, well.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Nothing really left to do but get some shut-eye, I guess.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Maybe I'll dream about a happier time long, long ago.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: A time when a dog could lie on his bed.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: A time when a dog could get a bath and a belly rub from time to time.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: A time before this silly ol' calf ever showed up.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: A time when. . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: When. . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Zzzzzzzzz. . .

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Snort-HUH?!?

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Ahh.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Now this is more like it!

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Don't worry everyone.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: There's plenty of me to go around.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: And looks like there's enough tender loving care around here for everyone.

title: CHARLIE AND THE NEW BABY
author: REE DRUMMOND
text: Even Abigail!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: When springtime comes, in his warm winter den a bear wakes up very hungry and thin!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He waddles outside and roots all around.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He digs and he paws fresh shoots from the ground.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He nibbles on his lawn till the last blade is gone.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: But the bear wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Mouse scampers by with his acorn pail.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Come along, Mouse squeaks, to Strawberry Vale!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: So up Mouse hops onto Bear's big back.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: They tromp through the woods for a fresh fruit snack.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: The berries grow sweet, and they eat, eat, EAT!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: But the bear wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: The noon sun glows, when along hops Hare.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Good day, friend Mouse! How do, friend Bear?

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: I'm HUNGRY! roars Bear.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Hare says, Follow me! There's a fresh clover patch by the cottonwood tree.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: They nibble on their lunch, with a crunch, crunch, crunch!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: But the bear wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Badger shuffles by with his new fishin' pole.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: There's a fine fish feast at the o1' fishin' hole.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: They head to the pond and they sit by the shore.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Bear catches fish, . . .  but he still wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Meanwhile. . .  back at the big bear's den wait Gopher and Mole with Raven and Wren.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: They bake honey cakes.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: They decorate the lair.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: It's a springtime party for their good friend Bear!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Bear rubs at his tummy.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He smells something YUMMY. . .

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: And he still wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Bear sniffs and he snuffles as a sweet breeze blows.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He romps to his home.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He follows his nose.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: His friends yell SURPRISE! when he gets to his den.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: But Bear is SO big. . .  that he can't fit in!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Bear wails, What luck! I am STUCK, STUCK, STUCK. . .  in my own front door!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Mouse squeaks, Poor Bear.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He is wedged too tight.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Hare tugs, Raven Pushes with all of their might.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Badger gets a stick and he pries SO hard. . .  that Bear POPS out and he lands in his yard!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Since Bear is SO WIDE, they party outside.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: And he still wants more!

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: Bear opens presents; he gobbles honey cakes.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He eats SO much that his big tummy aches.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He snuggles in the grass and he snores big snores.

title: BEAR WANTS MORE
author: KARMA WILSON
text: He is full, full, full. . .  but. . .  his friends want more!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 1 told 2 and 2 told 3, I'll race you to the top of the apple tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Here comes 9 to the apple tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Next comes 10 and then 11.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Wow, these apples taste like heaven!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1,2,3. . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Will there be a place for me?

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 16's next to make the scene, climbing branches with 17.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 18, 19, one more's 20.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Numbers, numbers, there are plenty.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1, 2, 3. . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Will there be a place for me?

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Curvy 30, flat-foot 40 climbing up to join the party!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 50's fine and 60's dandy.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 70's hair is long and sandy.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1, 2, 3. . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Will there be a place for me?

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Let's climb more, says treetop 80, higher and higher, up to 90, until at last there's 99, and all the numbers are feeling fine, except for 0, who begins to cry.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1,2,3 . . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Will there be a place for me?

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Oh, no!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Buzzing close!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Bumblebees!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 0 hides behind the tree.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: GET OUT OF OURTREE! the bumblebees shout, and all the numbers tumble out.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 90, 80, 70 fall, hit the ground in a free-for-all.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: No more climbing, no more fun!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 30 next, then sweet little 20.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Numbers, numbers, no longer plenty!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 19 and 18, my, oh my!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Frightened numbers jump and fly!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Now 14 has hit the floor.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: And 13, too-unlucky guy!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 12 had almost touched the sky!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Bent-up 11.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: (Wait! Where's 10?)

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 9,8,7 follow then.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Twisted 6 and top-hat 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, take a dive!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1, 2,3. . .  Now I know the place for me!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 0 lands on top of the tree, joins with 10.

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Now 100 you see!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka Chicka 1,2,3. . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Here's the place that's just for me!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: All the numbers come back out, higher and higher, as they shout . . .

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: Chicka, Chicka 1,2,3!

title: CHICKA CHICKA 1-2-3
author: BILL MARTIN JR
text: 0's hero of the number tree!

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I'm Emily Elizabeth, and I have a dog named Clifford.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We saw a sign that said the circus was in town.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: A smaller sign said the circus needed help.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We always wanted to join a circus.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We ran there as fast as Clifford could run.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The owner said everything was going wrong.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He didn't think they could put on the show.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I told him Clifford and I would help him.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He didn't think a girl and her dog could be much help.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But I said, The show must go on.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The first problem was the lions and tigers.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: They wouldn't obey the animal trainer.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford gave them a command.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: They listened to Clifford.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: After that the animal trainer didn't have to worry anymore.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Some clowns had quit the circus.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The other clowns needed help with their act.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I was sure Clifford could help.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford tried on some costumes.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He found one he liked and joined the act.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford enjoyed being a clown.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He wagged his tail.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: That made the act even better.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The tightrope walker had a sprained ankle.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford tried to walk the tightrope.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He was pretty good.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: It wasn't his fault that he couldn't get off the ground.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Before the next act we walked out on the midway.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford loves cotton candy.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He sniffed it.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He sniffed a little too hard.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Licking the cotton candy off his nose made him thirsty.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He took a drink.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The circus man tried to stop him.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: It was too late.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford had spoiled the high diver's act.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But he didn't spoil the high diver.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Whew, that was close.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The second half of the circus began with the elephants on parade.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The biggest elephant had a cold in its nose and couldn't lead the parade.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: So Clifford slipped into an elephant suit and gave them a hand.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I mean a tail.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The next act was the human cannon ball.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: She didn't have any gunpowder for her cannon.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: So Clifford helped her out.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He helped her right out of the tent.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Then came the grand finale.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I was going up in a balloon with the circus man.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Everyone came out to watch.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Oh dear, the rope broke.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I didn't worry.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: I knew Clifford would save us.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He rushed to the rescue.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But he missed the rope.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We were blowing away.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Things looked bad.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford didn't give up.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He grabbed an extra tent pole.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: He used some telephone wire and took aim.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Bull's-eye!

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: The balloon was falling like a rock.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: We were scared silly.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: But Clifford got there in time.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Good old Clifford.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Everybody said it was the most exciting end a circus ever had.

title: CLIFFORD AT THE CIRCUS
author: NORMAN BRIDWELL
text: Clifford saved the show, and me.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The sun did not shine.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It was too wet to play.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So we sat in the house all that cold, cold, wet day.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I sat there with sally.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We sat there, we two.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And i said, how i wish we had something to do!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Too wet to go out and too cold to play ball.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So we sat in the house.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We did nothing at all.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So all we could do was to sit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Sit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Sit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Sit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And we did not like it.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not one little bit.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And then something went bump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: How that bump made us jump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We looked!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then we saw him step in on the mat!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We looked!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And we saw him!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: The cat in the hat!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he said to us, why do you sit there like that?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: i know it is wet and the sun is not sunny.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But we can have lots of good fun that is funny!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: i know some good games we could play, said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: i know some new tricks, said the cat in the hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: a lot of good tricks.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will show them to you.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Your mother will not mind at all if i do.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then sally and i did not know what to say.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Our mother was out of the house for the day.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But our fish said, no! No!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Make that cat go away!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Tell that cat in the hat you do not want to play.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He should not be here.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He should not be about.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He should not be here when your mother is out!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: now! Now! Have no fear.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Have no fear! said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: my tricks are not bad, said the cat in the hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Why, we can have lots of good fun, if you wish, with a game that I call up-up-up with a fish!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Put me down! said the fish.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: This is no fun at all!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Put me down! said the fish.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not wish to fall!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Have no fear! said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not let you fall.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will hold you up high As I stand on a ball.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With a book on one hand!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And a cup on my hat!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But that is not ALL I can do! Said the cat . . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at me!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at me now! said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With a cup and a cake On the top of my hat!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hold up two books!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hold up the fish!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And a little toy ship!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And some milk on a dish!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And look!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hop up and down on the ball!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But that is not all!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, no.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That is not all . . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at me!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at me!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at me Now!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It is fun to have fun But you have to know how.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hold up the cup And the milk and the cake!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hold up these books!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the fish on a rake!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can hold the toy ship And a little toy man!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And look!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: With my tail I can hold a red fan!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I can fan with the fan as I hop on the ball!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But that is not all.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, no.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That is not all. . . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That is what the cat said . . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then he fell on his head!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He came down with a bump from up there on the ball.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And Sally and I, We saw all the things fall!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And our fish came down, too.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He fell into a pot!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He said, Do I like this?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, no!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: This is not a good game, Said our fish as he lit.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: No, I do not like it, Not one little bit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Now look what you did! Said the fish to the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Now look at this house!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at this!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Look at that!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You sank our toy ship, Sank it deep in the cake.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You shook up our house and you bent our new rake.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You should not be here when our mother is not.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You get out of this house! Said the fish in the pot.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But I like to be here.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, I like it a lot! Said the Cat in the Hat To the fish in the pot.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will not go away.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I do not wish to go!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And so, said the Cat in the Hat, So so so. . .  I will show you another good game that I know!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And then he ran out.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And, then, fast as a fox, The Cat in the Hat Came back in with a box.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: A big red wood box.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It was shut with a hook.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Now look at this trick, Said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Take a look!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then he got up on top With a tip of his hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I call this game FUN-IN-A-box, Said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: In this box are two things I will show to you now.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will like these two things, Said the cat with a bow.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will pick up the hook.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will see something new.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Two things.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I call them Thing One and thing Two.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: These things will not bite you.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They want to have fun.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then, out of the box Came Thing Two and Thing One!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And they ran to us fast.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They said, How do you do?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Would you like to shake hands With Thing One and Thing Two?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And Sally and I Did not know what to do.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So we had to shake hands With Thing One and Thing Two.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We shook their two hands.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But our fish said, No! No!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Those Things should not be in this house!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Make them go!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They should not be here when your mother is not!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Put them out!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Put them out! said the fish in the pot.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Have no fear, little fish, Said the Cat in the Hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: These Things are good Things.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he gave them a pat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They are tame.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, so tame!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They have come here to play.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They will give you some fun on this wet, wet, wet day.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Now, here is a game that they like, Said the cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They like to fly kites, Said the Cat in the Hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: No!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not in the house! said the fish in the pot.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They should not fly kites in a house!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They should not.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, the things they will bump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, the things they will hit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, I do not like it!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Not one little bit!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then Sally and I Saw them run down the hall.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: We saw those two Things Bump their kites on the wall!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Bump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Thump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Thump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Bump!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Down the wall in the hall.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Thing two and thing one!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They ran up!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: They ran down!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: On the string of one kite we saw mother's new gown!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Her gown with the dots that are pink, white and red.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then we saw one kite bump on the head of her bed.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then those Things ran about with big bumps, jumps and kicks and with hops and big thumps and all kinds of bad tricks.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I said, I do not like the way that they play!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: If Mother could see this, Oh, what would she say!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then our fish said, Look! Look!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And our fish shook with fear.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Your mother is on her way home!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Do you hear?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, what will she do to us?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What will she say?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh, she will not like it to find us this way!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So, Do something! Fast! said the fish.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Do you hear!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I saw her.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Your mother!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Your mother is near!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So, as fast as you can, think of something to do!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You will have to get rid of Thing One and Thing Two!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: So, as fast as I could, I went after my net.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I said, With my net I can get them I bet.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I bet, with my net, I can get those Things yet!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then I let down my net.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: It came down with a PLOP!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And I had them!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: At last!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Those two things had to stop.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then I said to the cat, Now you do as I say.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You pack up those things and you take them away!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh dear! said that cat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: You did not like our game. . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Oh dear.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What a shame!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What a shame!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What a shame!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then he shut up the Things In the box with the hook.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And the cat went away with a sad kind of look.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: That is good, said the fish.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He has gone away.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Yes.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: But your mother will come.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: She will find this big mess!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And this mess is so big and so deep and so tall, We can not Pick it up.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: There is no way at all!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And THEN!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Who was back in the house?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Why, the cat!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Have no fear of this mess, said the Cat in the Hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I always pick up all my playthings and so. . .

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: I will show you another Good trick that I know!

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then we saw him pick up all the things that were down.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: He picked up the cake, And the rake, and the gown, And the milk, and the strings, And the books, and the dish, And the fan, and the cup, and the ship, and the fish.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And he put them away.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then he said, That is that.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And then he was gone with a tip of his hat.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Then our mother came in and she said to us two, Did you have any fun?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Tell me.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: What did you do?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: And Sally and I did not know what to say.

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Should we tell her the things that went on there that day?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Should we tell her about it?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Now, what should we do?

title: THE CAT IN THE HAT
author: DR. SEUSS
text: Well. . .  What would you do if your mother asked you?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Hello!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Scooty scoot scoot!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: May I have a cookie, please?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Oh!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Thanks!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Flappy Flip Flap!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: That was very nice of you!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Oh!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Look at all those nuts.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Hey!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: How did you get that cookie!?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I asked for it.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: You asked for it. . . .

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Politely.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Say, does that cookie have nuts?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yes.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: So, you got a cookie with nuts just by asking!?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Politely.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I ask for things all the time!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I ask to drive the bus!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I ask for hot dog parties!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Do I ask for candy?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I do.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: It doesn't have to be a big bus y'know. . . .

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I'll ask for a French Fry Robot every now and then.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I've asked for a walrus!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Right now, I'm asking, Why?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Why?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Why?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Why?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Ohhhh. . .  there's more!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Sometimes I ask for a hug.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Or I'll ask for one more story!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I can't count the times I've asked for my own personal iceberg.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: I ask to stay up late!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Oh yeah, I'm the asking-est pigeon in town!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: But do I get what I ask for?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: No!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: It's not fair.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Ducklings get everything!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Pigeons like cookies, too!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: (Especially with nuts.)

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Why did you get that cookie!?!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: So I could give it to you.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: And another thing-Hubba-Whaa?!?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: You're giving me that cookie?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: With the nuts.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: That is so. . .  nice!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Thank you.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Thank you very much.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Mmmm. . . !

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Chomp!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: That is one cool duckling.

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Chomp!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Yes, sir!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: Bye!

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: May I have another cookie, please?

title: THE DUCKLING GETS A COOKIE!?
author: MO WILLEMS
text: But this time, no nuts.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It was night and some fireflies danced around the moon.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At five o'clock in the morning the sun came up.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: A friendly ladybug flew in from the left.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It saw a leaf with many aphids on it, and decided to have them for breakfast.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: But just then a grouchy ladybug flew in from the right.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It too saw the aphids and wanted them for breakfast.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Good morning, said the friendly ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Go away! shouted the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: I want those aphids.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: We can share them, suggested the friendly ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: No.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: They're mine, all mine, screamed the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Or do you want to fight me for them?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, answered the friendly ladybug sweetly.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It looked the other bug straight in the eye.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: The grouchy ladybug stepped back.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It looked less sure of itself.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough for me to fight, it said.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Then why don't you pick on somebody bigger?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: I'll do that! screeched the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: I'll show you!

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: It puffed itself up and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At six o'clock it met a yellow jacket.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the yellow jacket, showing its stinger.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At seven o'clock it met a stag beetle.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the stag beetle, opening its jaws.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At eight o'clock it came across a praying mantis.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the praying mantis, reaching out with its long front legs.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At nine o'clock it almost flew into a sparrow.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the sparrow, opening its sharp beak.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At ten o'clock it saw a lobster.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the lobster, stretching its claws.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At eleven o'clock it bumped into a skunk.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the skunk, starting to lift its tail.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At twelve noon it spotted a boa constrictor.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insis-s-s-t, said the snake, right after lunch.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At one o'clock it happened upon a hyena.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the hyena, laughing eerily and showing its teeth.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At two o'clock it met a gorilla.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the gorilla, beating its chest.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At three o'clock it ran into a rhinoceros.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the rhinoceros, lowering its horn.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At four o'clock it encountered an elephant.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: If you insist, said the elephant, raising its trunk and showing its big tusks.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, you're not big enough, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At five o'clock it met a whale.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Hey you, said the grouchy ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: But the whale did not answer at all.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: You're not big enough anyway, said the grouchy ladybug and flew off.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At five fifteen the grouchy ladybug said to one of the whale's flippers Hey you, want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: But it got no answer.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: So it flew on.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At five thirty the grouchy ladybug said to the whale's fin, Hey you, want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: But it got no answer.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: So it flew on.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At a quarter to six the grouchy ladybug said to the whale's tail, Hey you, want to fight?

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: And the whale's tail gave the grouchy ladybug such a SLAP. . .  that it flew across the sea and across the land.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: At six o'clock the grouchy ladybug arrived right back where it had started from.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Ah, here you are again, said the friendly ladybug.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: You must be hungry.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: There are still some aphids left.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: You can have them for dinner.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Oh, thank you, said the wet, tired, and hungry ladybug

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Soon all the aphids were gone.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: Thank you, said the leaf.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: You are welcome, answered both ladybugs, and they went to sleep.

title: THE GROUCHY LADYBUG
author: ERIC CARLE
text: The fireflies, who had been sleeping all day, came out to dance around the moon.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Everybody knows the story of the Three Little Pigs.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Or at least they think they do.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: But I'll let you in on a little secret.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Nobody knows the real story because nobody has ever heard my side of the story.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: I'm the wolf.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Alexander T Wolf.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: You can call me Al.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: I don't know how this whole Big Bad wolf thing got started, but it's all wrong.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Maybe it's because of our diet.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Hey, it's not my fault wolves eat cute little animals like bunnies and sheep and pigs.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: That's just the way we are.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: If cheeseburgers were cute, folks would probably think you were Big and Bad, too.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: But like I was saying, the whole Big Bad Wolf thing is all wrong.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: The real story is about a sneeze and a cup of sugar.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: Way back in Once Upon a Time time, I was making a birthday cake for my dear old granny.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: I had a terrible sneezing cold.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
text: I ran out of sugar.

title: THE TRUE STORY OF THE 3 LITTLE PIGS!
author: JON SCIESZKA
